dmca.title: DMCA. Copyrights violation.
dmca.body:
-----Original Message-----
From: Ryan Cathcart [mailto:piracy@templatemonster.com] 
Posted At: Tuesday, May 30, 2006 7:52 AM
Posted To: Copyright
Conversation: DMCA. Copyrights violation.
Subject: DMCA. Copyrights violation.


To whom it may concern

Dear Sirs,

I am the legal assistant of Artvertex, Inc (http://templatemonster.com).
We received the piracy report that lead to http://excluz.com/ website.

It has come to our attention that your or one of your customer's servers
IP address (70.84.192.18), is involved in a grave situation of
unauthorized intellectual and graphic property distribution.

Site http://excluz.com/ distributes stolen web design materials. These
publications have no license support documentation from the design
owning company and general website content confirms malicious intent
against our company.
The exact placement of infringement is:
http://tm.excluz.com/

These galleries contain recompiled sources which were ripped from the
original pre-view pages at http://TemplateMonster.com website. All of
the stolen source numbers (they usually start the topic from words TM)
correspond to the official products numeration.
We direct your attention to the fact of massive publications that
violate the copyrights of all major web design vendors such as boxedArt
and DesignLoad. Moreover, several posts directly shows that templates
were stolen from the Templatemonster.com collection.

We made direct contact with the site owner using his site contact form
and WHOIS database contact records.
According to WHOIS data, the site owner is a citizen of Russia. All
contact records lead to non existent phone numbers and unregistered mail
boxes.
The website contact form gave no response at any given term.

Because of the obvious Templatemonster products distribution, we direct
your attention to the terms of our company's License Agreement
(http://www.templatemonster.com/terms.php) which clearly prohibits the
reselling of our products by any potential or current customer.

Our website clearly states "Website pages content copyright -
2002-2005 Artvertex, Inc." The permission of  information publishing
actions from your server is illegal. Templatemonster.com website content
cannot be reproduced, copied, or edited in any manner or medium and is
therefore making you the possessor of illegal material. US copyright
laws protect all parts of this material.
The owner of this website has been notified of his actions, and has been
informed of the consequences. He ignored a feedback request confirming
that his site is illegal and has failed the amicable case solution.

Hence, we demand the immediate removal of http://excluz.com/ account
from your company server and the cease of distribution of any of our
products IMMEDIATELY.
We have already notified our corporate lawyers of this situation and we
will not hesitate to exercise our legal right to pursue this matter in a
court of law should you fail to meet our demand immediately.

Templatemonster.com is committed to investigating licensing infractions
not only to protect our own interests but to protect those of the
designers who submit their designs to us as well. We are contractually
obliged to protect the intellectual property rights and livelihood of
the artists whose work we license. While we support freedom of
expression, we must enforce our licensing conditions rigorously in order
to meet our responsibilities. We feel that your cooperation regarding
this matter is fully warranted, and expect it will be promptly
forthcoming.

Thank you and waiting for your prompt answer.
----
Very truly yours,
Ryan Cathcart
Legal assistant
Artvertex, Inc.
Tel:  15183208716
FAX:  19175913014
mailto:piracy@templatemonster.com

note: DMCA form complain and screenshot attached.
